FUND FOR ADULT EDUCATION
914 E. Green Street
Pasadena 1, California
j
October 2, 1952
Mr. George E. Probst, Director
University of Chicago Round Table
The Univeristy of Chicago
Chicago 37, Illinois
Dear George:
On behalf of the Board of Directors of the Fund for Adult
Educations I want to extend to you and to every other
member of the NAEB Committee hearty congratulations on
the reception which your first three series received from
the press.
It is a source of great gratification to us as I am sure
it must be to you to receive such commendation from not
only newspapers such as THE NEW YORK TIMES but official
journals of the commercial industry such as BILLBOARD
and VARIETY.
I think’ that Jack Gould summed it up when he said something
like this, "Given the opportunity, given the finances, the
educational world has proved that it can make a real con¬
tribution to the best in radio."
It has been a long time since we have all met together and
I hope that it wiil be my pleasure to meet with you all
again soon, at which time I want to have the pleasure of
extending ray personal congratulations.
All members of the staff are looking forward to hearing
the rest of "The Jeffersonian Series" as they are actually
broadcast in Los Angeles, Chicago and New York.
With warm regards.
Sincerely,
l
C. Scott Fletcher
President
